required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Pantoprazole in Patients Older Than 12 Years With Reflux Associated Sleep Disorders (PULS)
clinical_study.official_title: Pantoprazole for the Treatment of GERD Associated Symptoms Focusing on Sleep Disorders.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study was to evaluate the effect of Pantoprazole 20 mg/40 mg for 14 days on symptoms in patients with NERD (non-erosive reflux disease) or eGERD (erosive gastroesophageal reflux disease) with special focus on the reduction of symptomatic sleep disorders.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the Severity of Sleep Disturbances
primary_outcome.time_frame: first and last visit (after a median of 18 days)
primary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=none, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=severe

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Change of Quality of Sleep During Therapy With Pantoprazole
primary_outcome.time_frame: last visit (after a median of 18 days)
primary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with considerably improved improved unchanged

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the Severity of Heartburn
secondary_outcome.time_frame: first and last visit (after a median of 18 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=none, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=severe

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the Severity of Eructation/Acid Eructation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: first and last visit (after a median of 18 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=none, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=severe

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the Severity of Epigastric Complaints/Epigastric Pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: first and last visit (after a median of 18 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=none, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=severe

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the Severity of Sensation of Fullness/Abdominal Distension
secondary_outcome.time_frame: first and last visit (after a median of 18 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=none, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=severe

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the Efficacy of Pantoprazole at Final Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: last visit (after a median of 18 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=excellent, 2=good, 3=satisfactory, 4=not satisfactory

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the Tolerability of Pantoprazole at Final Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: last visit (after a median of 18 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=excellent, 2=good, 3=satisfactory, 4=not satisfactory

intervention.description: This was an observational study. Therefore, the physician decided about dosage according to individual needs.

criteria.textblock:
Main inclusion criteria:
- GERD
- NERD
Main exclusion criteria:
- Criteria as defined in the Summary of Product Characteristics

overall_official.last_name: Dr. Thomas D. Bethke, MD, MBA

measure.title: Age
measure.description: The measured value is related to the number of 8502 subjects (= valid cases). This number differs from the overall number of baseline participants due to missing data for 114 subjects.

outcome.population: All patients included and treated, intention to treat, missing values not imputed

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
